data.title: What the new Top Gun movie tells us about American power
data.meta_description: The original film arrived at a moment of rising American global supremacy, but its sequel reflects anxiety over the US’ relative decline in the face of China’s high-tech military might.
data.text:
James Crabtree

Jun 3, 2022 – 5.00am

EmailLinkedInTwitterFacebook

Subscribe to gift this article

Gift 5 articles to anyone you choose each month when you subscribe.

Subscribe now

Already a subscriber?

Tom Cruise’s latest blockbuster, Top Gun: Maverick, arrived in cinemas last week with impeccable geopolitical timing. President Joe Biden met leaders from Australia, Japan and India in Tokyo last Tuesday, having earlier visited South Korea.

The US president aimed to reassure partners about his nation’s commitment to their region, even as US attention is drawn ever more towards a bloody and lengthening war in Ukraine.
